DOC.brief_summary: Project PEER utilize randomize controlled study design investigate combine effect exercise nutrition intervention base self-efficacy principle deliver primarily peer educator reduce risk obesity female college freshman one academic year ( N = 300 ) . The control group receive minimal interaction research team , parallel typical freshman experience UIUC campus . Recruitment take place two wave ( consecutive fall term n = 150 ) . During final year ( Fall 2010 ) project , General Education course offer target weight management . Importantly , discussion group course teach peer educator train use peer resource refine PEER project . In addition conventional measure content knowledge assess college classroom obtain class credit , personal physical activity nutrition behavior along behavioral determinant ( self-efficacy , self-regulatory skill outcome expectation ) also assess . Primary Aim 1 : To determine effectiveness peer-delivered self efficacy-based behavioral intervention enhance nutrition physical activity behavior subsequently weight management success female university freshman one academic year . We hypothesize freshman randomize intervention group successful lose maintain weight control group combination diet physical activity strategy . Primary Aim 2 : To examine role play social cognitive factor change nutrition physical activity behavior across one academic year . We hypothesize self-efficacy direct influence behavior indirect effect influence self-regulatory skill outcome expectation .
DOC.brief_title: Peer Education , Exercising Eating Right - Obesity Prevention Freshmen Women
